channel.title: [PI] Cycleevents - Rep++
channel.description: Title pretty much says it all, I need to fully understand what it does and how it would make fires of firemaking running out.

item.title: [PI] Cycleevents - Rep++
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

You would add whatever method you’re using to stop the fire into the stop() method

So, you’d want to delete the fire and make the ashes show in that method.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cycleevents - Rep++
item.dc:creator: @DaMatt17 DaMatt17
item.description:
@DaMatt17 wrote:

Thanks, could you explain me one more thing, how do I make it so that it makes the fire, and when the timer has stopped, the object resets?

Read full topic

							//TODO add timer information here

						@Override
						public void stop() {
							//TODO add ashes here
							}
						}, 1);

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cycleevents - Rep++
item.dc:creator: @DaMatt17 DaMatt17
item.description:
@DaMatt17 wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:2, topic:438110”]Everything within the server is run at some point or another, or it’s not a feature of your server.

If you cram it into process, regardless of whether or not its needed for that cycle (cycle being a game tick, 600ms), it will be ran.

The cycle event manager is unique in that it allows for events, such as firemaking, to be run, except only when called.

It could be used to make the fires turn to ashes by adding a timer, so every time they light a fire the event is called and then the timer run.[/quote]

Could you give me an example?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cycleevents - Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Everything within the server is run at some point or another, or it’s not a feature of your server.

If you cram it into process, regardless of whether or not its needed for that cycle (cycle being a game tick, 600ms), it will be ran.

The cycle event manager is unique in that it allows for events, such as firemaking, to be run, except only when called.

It could be used to make the fires turn to ashes by adding a timer, so every time they light a fire the event is called and then the timer run.

Read full topic
